sentences.sContent: Finally, Milton has revised and undone the anticipatory logic of the great career narrative.
sentences.sContent_eng: Finally, Milton has revised and undone the anticipatory logic of the great career narrative.
sentences.sCn: 最终，弥尔顿完善了这份伟大职业的,预期的解说逻辑的框架。

sentences.sContent: Perhaps it will go further than that: your children, before they even begin to show any signs of inattentiveness or hyperactivity, will experience a kind of anticipatory stigma.
sentences.sContent_eng: Perhaps it will go further than that: your children, before they even begin to show any signs of inattentiveness or hyperactivity, will experience a kind of anticipatory stigma.
sentences.sCn: 也许事情还不止于此：你的孩子在他们表露出任何注意力分散或者过度活跃的迹象之前就会受到某种预期的偏见。

synos.tran: 预期的；提早发生的；期待着的

remMethod.val: 来自anticipate(v. 预测， 预料)

words.tran: 希望；预感；先发制人；预支
预期，期望；占先，抢先；提前使用
